papers.title: High Power Proton Beam Facilities: Operational Experience, Challenges, and the Future
authors: High power proton accelerators are increasingly popular as drivers for secondary beams with a large variety of applications
such as neutron sources for materials science and neutrino factories for high energy physics. In the last few decades
average beam powers have increased substantially

giving rise to an array of challenges centered on providing high beam power and availability while maintaining low activation levels. This talk summarizes the current status of high power proton accelerators. It discusses recent operational experiences and lessons learned
and identifies the primary hardware and beam dynamics limitations. A brief review of planned next generation facilities and driving technologies is also presented.

papers.title: Future Circular Colliders
authors: This talk should review plans for future circular colliders with 50-100 km circumference for an electron-positron Higgs factory and 50-100 TeV hadron collider
and describe progress of R&D and design efforts for such future colliders possibly located in China and/or at CERN.

papers.title: Science with 4th Generation Photon Sources
authors: The talk should describe the scientific opportunities enabled by 4th generation photon sources
including diffraction limited storage-rings and FELs.
